title: Rayman2: The Great Escape
content:
Honestly, I'll be blunt. Micheal Ancel was a damn genius for creating half the ideas that went into this game.

This is one of the few 3D games that I've beat start to finish over hundred times, and still is fun to beat. I honestly have honed this game into a craft. I really loved the first one, but I love this one even more (And that's saying something, becase i <3 Rayman), and the third one was aiight, so was Arena, but the second.... Was as godly as CK, Biomenace, and Crystal Caves.

Has anyone played it as much as I have/liked it as much as I?~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

Rayman fans should try the 'Rayman 10th Anniversary Collection' games which are currently available on various platforms, and each feature a few Rayman oldies, although not all may be necessarily good. They're pretty cheap too.

I'd say the PC version is the best in terms of value as you get 4 Rayman oldies. The PS2 version has 3 (Rayman M, Revolution and Rayman 3), and the GBA version has 2 (Rayman Advance and Rayman 3).-- Censorship is F**ked! --
